topic.title: What is Create & Print?
topic.content:
Create & Print was developed for people who like to express themselves with one-of-a-kind cards, notes, envelopes, invitations, and more. Our printable projects are easy to design and personalize, and fun to send.
You can:
Add a photo to your projects
Double-check your spelling
Save your completed project so you can use it again in the future
Create & Print helps you do all that and more!
Whether you are celebrating a special occasion, or just keeping in touch, Create & Print has lots of ways to help you say what's on your mind and in your heart. We'll give you art and words. You add the magic.

topic.title: Getting started - How to use Create & Print
topic.content:
Starting at the home page of Create & Print, you can browse through all of the available categories of projects to find one that meets your needs.
The left side of the page will allow you to navigate through the project design categories. Click on the category names to open and explore them.
The right side of the page will show you the thumbnail images of various projects in that category.
To see a larger preview of the project, click on the thumbnail image.
If you would like to view more projects you can click the Back button to return to the thumbnails page, or you can just select a new category.
Continue to browse until you find the right project for your needs. Click on the Personalize and Print This Project link to open up the Create & Print Workspace. In the workspace, you can personalize your project by changing the text, adding new text messages, adding a favorite photo, and so much more. Have fun!
When you have completed your personalizations, click the Print button. Your project will be sent to your printer.
Tips:
The first time you print a note card or greeting card, be sure to run a paper feed print test in the Print window. You'll only need to do this the first time you print a card and Create & Print will remember your settings.
All text on the Create & Print greeting cards and projects can be edited to fit your specific need. If you see a Floral design in Thank you that you think would make a great Anniversary greeting, just change the text message. It is easy, fast and fun!

topic.title: Using the Creative Workspace
topic.content:
After you have chosen the project you want to personalize, click on the Personalize and Print This Project link and the Create & Print Workspace window will pop up. The Workspace is where you can personalize and print your greeting card or project. You can add, delete, or change text and art elements.
You can start by simply highlighting the project's existing text message and begin typing. Your keystrokes will change the sentiment right on your screen. You can also change the size, color, alignment and type of font used on your project, and add shapes or photos.
There are many other tools available in the workspace if you wish to create a truly unique printed project. Each button icon represents one of the tools in the workshop. If you need a quick hint as to what each tool does, place the cursor over the tool icon. Hold the pointer over the tool icon for a several seconds and the message will appear.

topic.title: Browser Support
topic.content:
We strongly recommend you use Create & Print with either Internet Explorer 5.5 (or higher) or Netscape 4.7x (or higher). Create & Print is not compatible with Macintosh computers, WebTV, Eye Opener, or Internet Appliances.
For Internet Explorer, go to www.microsoft.com/ie, then Downloads.
For Netscape, got to www.netscape.com, then browser central.

topic.title: Printing
topic.content:
Select Print in the software program.
Choose your printer from the menu.
Choose the Paper Feed Settings button to set the way paper feeds into the printer (right side, left side, or center).
When the print test is complete, insert the Photo Cards paper and print your project.
NOTE: The first time you print, the application will run a paper feed print test to make sure the software works correctly with your printer. Use plain paper and follow the on-screen instructions to print the test page.

topic.title: When I print 4X8 Photo Cards, nothing prints or only half of the design prints. What do I do?
topic.content:
All printers feed custom sized paper differently. In order for Create And Print to determine how to print on 4X8 Photo Cards using your printer, you need to set the Paper Feed Settings within the Print dialog box. To do this:
Click Paper Feed Settings located within the print dialog box.
Under Feeds from:, if the Right option is selected, then change to Left. If the Left option is selected, then change to Right. In other words, opposite of the way it was set when you entered the Paper Feed Settings dialog.
Click OK to save changes and reprint your card.

topic.title: Is Create & Print safe to install on my computer?
topic.content: Yes. The Create & Print software is developed by AmericanGreetings.com and is guaranteed to be safe from any virus.

topic.title: How do I change greeting card sizes?
topic.content:
All greeting cards can be printed as ½-fold or ¼-fold. This is done within the print dialog box.
Complete your project and click the Print button.
The print dialog box will appear. In the lower left corner, click on either Half-fold or Quarter-fold to indicate what size greeting card you would like to print.
Click the OK button and your project will be sent to your printer for printing.

topic.title: How do I Add-A-Photo to my project?
topic.content:
You can add a photo to any Create & Print project. Some projects are specifically designed as Add-A-Photo projects, with a space for your photo incorporated into the project layout. But photos can be added to all projects. You just need to decide where to feature the photo.
Add-A-Photo projects:
If you have chosen a project that incorporates the Add-A-Photo feature in its design, you can simply double-click on the words "Double-Click to Add-A-Photo®" to place an image within the card or project.
The Add-A-Photo dialog box will open. Browse your hard drive for the photo you would like to attach to the project. When you have found it, click the Open button. The picture will insert itself into he designed location.
All Projects:
Click on the Photo button located in the left hand tool bar. The Add-A-Photo dialog box will open and you can browse your hard drive to find a photo. When you find the one you want, click the Open button. The photo will be dropped in the center of the project. Double-click on the inserted photo to move it anywhere on the project, or to resize it.
Resizing and moving photos:
To resize a photo, click the photo to select it, and then drag the handles in any direction to make the photo the size you would like. Dragging the photo by the corners will maintain the aspect ratio and will not distort the image.
To move a photo, click and drag it from any point within the photo and move it to a different location. Use the arrow keys on the keboard to "tweak" the location by a very small amount.

topic.title: What kind of paper is best to use with Create & Print?
topic.content: Greeting card stock is generally best, and is available at most office supply stores and many department stores. Card stock is comparable to store-bought card quality, and is pre-scored to make folding easier. But any high quality, heavyweight paper is also great for your Create & Print projects.

topic.title: How does a half-fold greeting print?
topic.content: Half-fold greetings print on both sides of the paper. You will have to reinsert the paper to print on both sides. After Create & Print has checked to see what type of printer you have, it may need to run a paper feed print test using a single sheet of plain paper. Next, a series of dialog boxes will give you the exact instructions specific to your printer. Simply follow the instructions, click the Next button when prompted, and you will have no difficulty printing your greetings.

topic.title: How does a quarter-fold greeting print?
topic.content: Quarter-fold greetings print with all of the art and text on one side of the paper. After you have printed your card, just fold the paper in half twice, and your greeting will be finished!

topic.title: How many copies of my project can I print?
topic.content: You can print as many copies as you like. This feature can be especially helpful when you are printing invitations, newsletters, labels, envelopes, or announcements. Look for the Number of copies field in the Print dialog box.

topic.title: How do I print Envelopes?
topic.content:
Create & Print includes an envelope wizard to set up and print envelopes. Follow the on-screen instructions to personalize the envelopes. Print the envelopes the same way you print a card; it should not require any special print setup.
All envelopes are categorized by size. ½-fold envelopes are the correct size for ½-fold greeting cards, ¼-fold envelopes fit the ¼-fold cards and Stationery Envelopes are designed for the #10 business envelop. Currently you cannot print a ½-fold size envelope with a ¼-fold envelope design.
To specify how your printer will print the envelopes
Click Paper Feed Settings located within the print dialogue box.
Set the envelope position (left, center or right).
Set the position of the flap (face up or face down).
Set the leading edge (this is the edge that is facing the printer).
Click OK when ready to print
